Friendly customer service.But the manager Tyler is lazy and a liar. I spent about an HR waiting for a shower and Tyler said we only have 4 showers and they're being used. But this wasn't the case. There was at least one shower open and …

Bathroom for men was filthy,  common problem at most Pilots it seems.  Shower in the morning was clean and hot, 5 stars for that.  Not much truck parking and over full early with all the 'creative's spots quickly filled.

showerReviews.reviewText: … visit at TA, 1101 NC Highway 61, I purchased 108 gallons of diesel and 13.5 gallons of DEF. After my purchase, I asked the store manager for a shower. I was informed that I could not receive one because I do not yet have a loyalty card. As …

… that ticket. Their stores are junky. Their food is a ripoff. $11 for a cheap chopped salad that costs them $1. $7 for a bologna sandwich. Popeyes charging $16 for some tiny tenders. The shower kiosk was built in the 1980’s. Piss on them.

Showers were better than most TA’s I’ve been to, the guy was very nice didn’t get his name.  Showers were fairly small and there are no amenities as far as hanging your clothes this is a down side to almost every TA/Petro. Dryers were trash …

… than $800 in gas, I insert the wrong phone number on the cashier register. I tried to get a shower and these ladies said that my phone number doesn’t match the ID. I showed them the fuel receipt and she asked me to pay for the shower . …

showerReviews.reviewText: All facilities are well-maintained and clean. We reserved picnic area 3 and it was big enough for 30 people. It has an on-site grill and a few covered waste bins.  It is 5 minutes away from the beach but the road is unpaved.

We love camping at this place. The facilities are always clean. The park rangers are inviting and very helpful. The camping spots are roomy. Be careful to pay attention to which spot you book because all spots don't have water and electricity for camping. Don't forget to bring an extension cord.
Very clean and quiet campground. Spacious spots with plenty of woods between sites. This is our second visit and will be booking again soon!

We loved our time here! We usually go to Jordan Lake, but with the recent flooding it has been closed, but Falls Lake was just as great! We went to BeaverDam entrance. They have pavilions, grills, bathroom/changing house. Playground. And …
Clean beach, multiple bathrooms, multiple shower areas, playground, lots of shaded picnic areas. $10 per car.

Beautiful beach, it's nice and long. This beach has two change houses/ restroom as well as an outdoor shower. There is a playground, though it is made of metal so when it is hot the play time is limited on it. Plenty of picnic tables and …

… was our first time there as a family and we really enjoyed it. The bathrooms are what you would expect at a public beach, but it also has a shower to get the sand off your feet before putting on your sandals etc. Nice vibe...we'll be back!
Great place to go and relax as if you were On the beaches themselves! Also has bathrooms and shower

… a new pool vacuum cleaner. Another issue is that many skip the shower before swimming and I've complained and the staff has told me they can't force the shower situation, but only can put up a"please shower before entering the pool" sign.

… 30pm - and yes, we have tested this). If you want to reserve a court, it is only $5! Other facilities located throughout the park include a pool, playground, dog park,  indoor basketball courts and of course, restrooms (including a shower).

… of maintenance closure. Good lockers, bring your own lock. Soap dispenser was empty in the showers. I thought the shower was cold but person who came after me said it was warm, so I guess I didn’t let it run long enough. Plenty of 25 yard …

Wonderful! We reserved a shelter for a small get together baby shower to be COVID compliant. A ranger stopped by to make sure everything was alright during our event. Our dog even attended!!! 😊He was gracious and minimized his impact on our …

… , with only catfish biting (worms) near shore.  There's a small playground, and the bath house was well kept, though the shower plumbing was inconsistent between hot and cold directions!  (Test the shower water temp first for younger folk! …
We had a nice campsite in first loop. Shower house old but functional. Very few trails, mainly just Mountain to Sea and short ones in camping area. Dog friendly. Nice staff at check-in.

… Only downside was mowing on Wednesday while I was in the shower.... dust filled the restroom and a second shower was required to wash off the red rivulets from the dust, and I had to switch clothes. …
Ample picnic tables and grills. There is a spot for everyone. Get the ones close to the beach and kids play area. There is a shower near kids play area.
Easy to check in and campsite was fine, but the water coming from our spout was yellow. It was also yellow in the toilets and shower. The video was after trying to let it run for a while.

Group camp sites are large enough to spread out, close to water and far enough away from other sites. Shower house is super clean. However, if you are looking to unplug and immerse yourself in nature this is not it. The Planes constantly …

… table. The dump station was in good condition.  Trash  dumpsters and trash cans are available. The bathrooms and shower facilities were clean and in good repair. We weren't there to boat, but noticed there is a Marina with gas available.
We camped here and it was beautiful, had good showers and a great lake area. Beware of swimmers itch though (shower with ample soap  immediately after enjoying the lake to avoid it).

… this issue. There is another beach, however it's got a problem with fowl droppings. The second issue is that the shower water was a fixed temperature. Since we were there during the hottest day of the year to date, I REALLY wanted …
